video.name: HOT AND SOUR SOUP WITH RAMEN RECIPE | EASY DINNER RECIPE - Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
HOT AND SOUR SOUP WITH RAMEN RECIPE | EASY DINNER RECIPE

Get the WRITTEN RECIPE here -  https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-hot-and-sour-soup-with-ramen/

SUBSCRIBE HERE: https://www.youtube.com/veganricharecipes?sub_confirmation=1

For a hearty fusion meal full of veggies and tofu try my Vegan Hot and Sour Soup with Ramen! The perfect Asian-inspired comfort food that’s ready in under 30 minutes!

Hot and sour soup, basically, the Asian version of chicken noodle soup. Soul-hugging and comforting. This hot and sour soup is Indo- Chinese version. Yes there’s a whole sub cuisine under Indian cuisine with Chinese and inspired dishes. To this simple soup, I add in some ramen noodles to cook with the soup to make for a hearty meal.

******MORE SOUP RECIPES FROM THE BLOG******

INSTANT POT CAULIFLOWER SOUP: https://www.veganricha.com/instant-pot-cauliflower-soup-vegan/

RED LENTIL TORTILLA SOUP: https://www.veganricha.com/lentil-tortilla-soup/

INSTANT POT TOMATO SOUP WITH CORNMEAL CRUSTED TOFU CROUTONS: https://www.veganricha.com/instant-pot-tomato-soup-tofu-croutons/

COOKBOOKS BY RICHA HINGLE (VEGAN RICHA): https://www.veganricha.com/mybooks/

#ramensouprecipe #hotandsoursoup #veganramenrecipe #veganricha #easyveganrecipes

recipeIngredient: 1 tbsp dark soy sauce (Or use 1 tbsp regular soy sauce, and 1 tsp molasses)
1 tbsp vinegar (such as rice vinegar, or white  vinegar)
a good dash of white pepper
3  or 4 green onions (chopped, keep most of the green parts for garnishing, and use the white and half of the green parts for the soup)

recipeInstructions.text: Add 5 cups of broth to a saucepan over medium heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 5 cups of broth to a saucepan over medium heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Mince your ginger, garlic, and chili together so that they get crushed together. Add that to the broth.
recipeInstructions.name: Mince your ginger, garlic, and chili together so that they get crushed together. Add that to the broth.

recipeInstructions.text: Add all the sauces, and seasonings, the soy sauce, dark soy sauce, vinegar, salt, peppers, and sugar to the broth.
recipeInstructions.name: Add all the sauces, and seasonings, the soy sauce, dark soy sauce, vinegar, salt, peppers, and sugar to the broth.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the mixture is starting to boil, add in your mushroom, carrots, tofu, and stir.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the mixture is starting to boil, add in your mushroom, carrots, tofu, and stir.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the mixture is rapidly boiling, add in the cabbage.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the mixture is rapidly boiling, add in the cabbage.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix in the cabbage, then carefully taste and adjust the flavor with the extra soy sauce, and vinegar if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix in the cabbage, then carefully taste and adjust the flavor with the extra soy sauce, and vinegar if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the white parts of green onions.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the white parts of green onions.

recipeInstructions.text: While the soup is boiling, make your cornstarch slurry with 1 tbsp of cornstarch mixed in 1/2 cup of the remaining broth.
recipeInstructions.name: While the soup is boiling, make your cornstarch slurry with 1 tbsp of cornstarch mixed in 1/2 cup of the remaining broth.

recipeInstructions.text: Toss in the ramen noodles , and once they have broken apart, and they seem like they're about to just be al dente, add in your cornstarch mixture, and mix well. Let the mixture start to boil again, and then take off heat. You don't want to cook the ramen noodles too much. You want them to be just about done, because they'll continue to cook in the hot broth.
recipeInstructions.name: Toss in the ramen noodles , and once they have broken apart, and they seem like they're about to just be al dente, add in your cornstarch mixture, and mix well. Let the mixture start to boil again, and then take off heat. You don't want to cook the ramen noodles too much. You want them to be just about done, because they'll continue to cook in the hot broth.

recipeInstructions.text: Take the pot off the heat, taste and adjust salt and flavor with soy sauce,salt, vinegar etc.  garnish with some pepper flakes or black pepper , and the remaining parts of the green onion, and serve immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: Take the pot off the heat, taste and adjust salt and flavor with soy sauce,salt, vinegar etc.  garnish with some pepper flakes or black pepper , and the remaining parts of the green onion, and serve immediately.
